data.name: Barboach

attacks.name: Hide
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from and effects of attacks done to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Its two whiskers provide a sensitive radar. Even in muddy waters, it can detect its prey's location.

data.name: Whiscash

attacks.name: Raging and Rocking
attacks.text: For each Fighting Energy attached to this Pokémon, discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

data.flavorText: It is extremely protective of its territory. If any foe approaches, it attacks using vicious tremors.

data.name: Crabrawler
data.flavorText: This Pokémon punches trees and eats the berries that drop down, training itself and getting food at the same time.

data.name: Crabominable

attacks.name: Knuckle Impact
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

data.flavorText: The detached pincers of these Pokémon are delicious. Some Trainers bring Lechonk into the mountains just to search for them.

data.name: Rockruff
data.flavorText: This Pokémon is very friendly when it's young. Its disposition becomes vicious once it matures, but it never forgets the kindness of its master.

data.name: Lycanroc

attacks.name: Finishing Fang
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has no damage counters on it before this attack does damage, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon uses its rocky mane to slash any who approach. It will even disobey its Trainer if it dislikes the orders it was given.

data.name: Glimmet

attacks.name: Iron Defense
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks.

data.flavorText: It absorbs nutrients from cave walls. The petals it wears are made of crystallized poison.

data.name: Paldean Wooper
data.flavorText: After losing a territorial struggle, Wooper began living on land. The Pokémon changed over time, developing a poisonous film to protect its body.

data.name: Paldean Clodsire

attacks.name: Splattering Poison
attacks.text: Both Active Pokémon are now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Venoshock
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Poisoned, this attack does 120 more damage.

data.flavorText: When attacked, this Pokémon will retaliate by sticking thick spines out from its body. It's a risky move that puts everything on the line.

data.name: Heatmor

attacks.name: Energy Burner
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: A flame serves as its tongue, melting through the hard shell of Durant so that Heatmor can devour their insides.

data.name: Floatzel

attacks.name: Swirling Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, put your opponent's Active Pokémon and all attached cards into your opponent's hand.

data.flavorText: With its flotation sac inflated, it can carry people on its back. It deflates the sac before it dives.

data.name: Tympole

attacks.name: Screw Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It uses sound waves to communicate with others of its kind. People and other Pokémon species can't hear its cries of warning.

data.name: Cubchoo

attacks.name: Trip Over
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: Many of this species can be found along the shorelines of cold regions. If a Cubchoo lacks dangling snot, there's a chance it is sick.

data.name: Cryogonal

attacks.name: First Freeze
attacks.text: If you go second and it's your first turn, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Cryogonal appear during cold seasons. It is said that people and Pokémon who die on snowy mountains are reborn into these Pokémon.

data.name: Magnemite
data.flavorText: The electromagnetic waves emitted by the units at the sides of its head expel antigravity, which allows it to float.

data.name: Tyranitar ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.
Tera: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).

attacks.name: Mountain Hurl
attacks.text: Discard the top 2 cards of your deck.

attacks.name: Lightning Rampage
attacks.text: If your Benched Pokémon have any damage counters on them, this attack does 100 more damage.

data.name: Tynamo
data.flavorText: While one alone doesn't have much power, a chain of many Tynamo can be as powerful as lightning.

data.name: Eelektrik

attacks.name: Volt Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: They coil around foes and shock them with electricity-generating organs that seem simply to be circular patterns.

data.name: Eelektross

attacks.name: Suction Shock
attacks.text: Switch in 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon to the Active Spot. If you do, this attack does 60 damage to the new Active Pokémon, and then flip a coin. If heads, that Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: They crawl out of the ocean using their arms. They will attack prey on shore and immediately drag it into the ocean.

data.name: Tadbulb

attacks.name: Shake and Discharge
attacks.text: This attack also does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Tadbulb shakes its tail to generate electricity. If it senses danger, it will make its head blink on and off to alert its allies.

data.name: Cleffa

attacks.name: Grasping Draw
attacks.text: Draw cards until you have 7 cards in your hand.

data.flavorText: Because of its unusual, starlike silhouette, people believe that it came here on a meteor.

data.name: Clefairy

attacks.name: Slap Slap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: Its adorable behavior and cry make it highly popular. However, this cute Pokémon is rarely found.

data.name: Togepi

attacks.name: Whiny Voice
attacks.text: Choose a random card from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals that card and shuffles it into their deck.

data.flavorText: It is considered to be a symbol of good luck. Its shell is said to be filled with happiness.

data.name: Togekiss

abilities.name: Precious Gift
abilities.text: Once at the end of your turn (after your attack), you may use this Ability. Draw cards until you have 8 cards in your hand.

attacks.name: Power Cyclone
attacks.text: Move an Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Known as a bringer of blessings, it's been depicted on good-luck charms since ancient times.

data.name: Snubbull

attacks.name: Double-Edge
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: In contrast to its appearance, it's quite timid. When playing with other puppy Pokémon, it sometimes gets bullied.

data.name: Lunatone

abilities.name: New Moon
abilities.text: If you have Solrock in play, prevent all effects of any Stadium done to your Pokémon in play.

data.flavorText: It was discovered at the site of a meteor strike 40 years ago. Its stare can lull its foes to sleep.

data.name: Greavard

attacks.name: Play Rough
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: It is said that a dog Pokémon that died in the wild without ever interacting with a human was reborn as this Pokémon.

data.name: Larvitar
data.flavorText: Born deep underground, this Pokémon becomes a pupa after eating enough dirt to make a mountain.

data.name: Pupitar

attacks.name: Blasting Tackle
attacks.text: This attack also does 20 damage to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: This pupa flies around wildly by venting with great force the gas pressurized inside its body.

data.name: Toedscruel

attacks.name: Double Whip
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 100 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: These Pokémon gather into groups and form colonies deep within forests. They absolutely hate it when strangers approach.

data.name: Koraidon ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Splitting Beam
attacks.text: This attack also does 20 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Gaia Press
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Lampent

attacks.name: Alluring Fireball
attacks.text: Switch in 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon to the Active Spot. This attack does 30 damage to the new Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It lurks in cities, pretending to be a lamp. Once it finds someone whose death is near, it will trail quietly after them.

data.name: Volcarona

attacks.name: Flame Cloak
attacks.text: Attach a Basic Fire Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Its burning body causes it to be unpopular in hot parts of the world, but in cold ones, Volcarona is revered as an embodiment of the sun.

data.name: Armarouge

abilities.name: Scorching Armor
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is in the Active Spot and is damaged by an attack from your opponent's Pokémon (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokémon is now Burned.

data.flavorText: Armarouge evolved through the use of a set of armor that belonged to a distinguished warrior. This Pokémon is incredibly loyal.

data.name: Sharpedo

attacks.name: Aqua Impact
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon is known as the Bully of the Sea. Any ship entering the waters Sharpedo calls home will be attacked—no exceptions.

data.name: Seismitoad

abilities.name: Quaking Zone
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, attacks used by your opponent's Active Pokémon cost Colorless more.

attacks.name: Echoed Voice
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Echoed Voice attack does 100 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: This Pokémon is popular among the elderly, who say the vibrations of its lumps are great for massages.

data.name: Toxtricity

attacks.name: Leer
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Loud Mix
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each different type of Pokémon on your Bench.

data.flavorText: Many youths admire the way this Pokémon listlessly picks fights and keeps its cool no matter what opponent it faces.

data.name: Bellibolt

attacks.name: Electrobullet
attacks.text: This attack also does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: When this Pokémon expands and contracts its wobbly body, the belly-button dynamo in its stomach produces a huge amount of electricity.

data.name: Mawile

attacks.name: Mischievous Crunch
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage for each Psychic Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It chomps with its gaping mouth. Its huge jaws are actually steel horns that have been transformed.

data.name: Spoink
data.flavorText: Spoink will die if it stops bouncing. The pearl on its head amplifies its psychic powers.

data.name: Greavard
data.flavorText: It is said that a dog Pokémon that died in the wild without ever interacting with a human was reborn as this Pokémon.

data.name: Nosepass

attacks.name: Iron Collecting
attacks.text: Put up to 2 Basic Metal Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand.

data.flavorText: It hunts without twitching a muscle by pulling in its prey with powerful magnetism. But sometimes it pulls natural enemies in close.

data.name: Bonsly

attacks.name: Blubbering
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: In order to adjust the level of fluids in its body, it exudes water from its eyes. This makes it appear to be crying.

data.name: Drilbur

attacks.name: Rising Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

data.flavorText: It's a digger, using its claws to burrow through the ground. It causes damage to vegetable crops, so many farmers have little love for it.

data.name: Stunfisk

abilities.name: Custom Trap
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, has a Pokémon Tool attached, and is damaged by an attack from your opponent's Pokémon (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 5 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Rumble
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

data.flavorText: For some reason, this Pokémon smiles slightly when it emits a strong electric current from the yellow markings on its body.

data.name: Klawf ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Counterattacking Pincer
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is in the Active Spot and is damaged by an attack from your opponent's Pokémon (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), discard an Energy from the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Falling Press
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 80 more damage.

data.name: Paldean Clodsire

attacks.name: Poison Ring
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. During your opponent's next turn, that Pokémon can't retreat.

attacks.name: Muddy Hammer
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

data.flavorText: When attacked, this Pokémon will retaliate by sticking thick spines out from its body. It's a risky move that puts everything on the line.

data.name: Chandelure

attacks.name: Combustion Chain
attacks.text: This attack does 50 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: In homes illuminated by Chandelure instead of lights, funerals were a constant occurrence—or so it's said.

data.name: Larvesta

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon was called the Larva That Stole the Sun. The fire Larvesta spouts from its horns can cut right through a sheet of iron.

data.name: Charcadet
data.flavorText: Burnt charcoal came to life and became a Pokémon. Possessing a fiery fighting spirit, Charcadet will battle even tough opponents.

data.name: Carvanha
data.flavorText: These Pokémon have sharp fangs and powerful jaws. Sailors avoid Carvanha dens at all costs.

data.name: Palpitoad
data.flavorText: On occasion, their cries are sublimely pleasing to the ear. Palpitoad with larger lumps on their bodies can sing with a wider range of sounds.

data.name: Froakie

attacks.name: Try Bouncing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: It protects its skin by covering its body in delicate bubbles. Beneath its happy-go-lucky air, it keeps a watchful eye on its surroundings.

data.name: Frogadier

attacks.name: Strafe
attacks.text: You may switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Its swiftness is unparalleled. It can scale a tower of more than 600 metres in a minute's time.

data.name: Wugtrio

attacks.name: Entwining Entrapment
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

data.flavorText: It has a vicious temperament, contrary to what its appearance may suggest. It wraps its long bodies around prey, then drags the prey into its den.

data.name: Finizen
data.flavorText: It likes playing with others of its kind using the water ring on its tail. It uses ultrasonic waves to sense the emotions of other living creatures.

data.name: Pawmot ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Levin Strike
attacks.text: Discard 2 Lightning Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 220 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Tadbulb

attacks.name: Thunder Jolt
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: Tadbulb shakes its tail to generate electricity. If it senses danger, it will make its head blink on and off to alert its allies.

data.name: Bellibolt

abilities.name: Insulator
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Lightning Pokémon.

attacks.name: Thunderous Edge
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: When this Pokémon expands and contracts its wobbly body, the belly-button dynamo in its stomach produces a huge amount of electricity.

data.name: Miraidon ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Rapid Draw
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Techno Turbo
attacks.text: Attach a Basic Lightning Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Togetic

attacks.name: Shared Peace
attacks.text: Each player draws 3 cards.

data.flavorText: It grows dispirited if it is not with kind people. It can float in midair without moving its wings.

data.name: Grumpig

attacks.name: Powerful Steps
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: It can perform odd dance steps to influence foes. Its style of dancing became hugely popular overseas.

data.name: Solrock

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: Solar energy is the source of its power, so it is strong during the daytime. When it spins, its body shines.

data.name: Polteageist

attacks.name: Antique Collecting
attacks.text: Put up to 2 in any combination of Item cards and Pokémon Tool cards from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Pour Tea
attacks.text: Put 5 damage counters on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The tea that composes Polteageist's body has a distinct and enjoyable flavor. Drinking too much, however, can be fatal.

data.name: Houndstone

attacks.name: Two Four-ocious
attacks.text: If your opponent has exactly 2 or 4 Prize cards remaining, this attack does 120 more damage.

data.flavorText: Houndstone spends most of its time sleeping in graveyards. Among all the dog Pokémon, this one is most loyal to its master.

data.name: Houndstone ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Big Bite
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

attacks.name: Last Respects
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each Psychic Pokémon in your discard pile.

data.name: Dugtrio

attacks.name: Dig
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from and effects of attacks done to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Its three heads bob separately up and down to loosen the soil nearby, making it easier for it to burrow.

data.name: Diggersby

attacks.name: Knocking Hammer
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

data.flavorText: The fur on its belly retains heat exceptionally well. People used to make heavy winter clothing from fur shed by this Pokémon.

data.name: Toedscool
data.flavorText: Toedscool lives in muggy forests. The flaps that fall from its body are chewy and very delicious.

data.name: Glimmet

attacks.name: Poison Shard
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: It absorbs nutrients from cave walls. The petals it wears are made of crystallized poison.

data.name: Glimmora ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Dust Field
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, your opponent can't have more than 3 Benched Pokémon. If they have 4 or more Benched Pokémon, they discard Benched Pokémon until they have 3 Pokémon on the Bench. If more than one effect changes the number of Benched Pokémon allowed, use the smaller number.

attacks.name: Poisonous Gem
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Charizard ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.
Tera: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).

abilities.name: Infernal Reign
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may search your deck for up to 3 Basic Fire Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Burning Darkness
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Prize card your opponent has taken.

data.name: Paldean Wooper

attacks.name: Spit Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: After losing a territorial struggle, Wooper began living on land. The Pokémon changed over time, developing a poisonous film to protect its body.

data.name: Houndour
data.flavorText: It is smart enough to hunt in packs. It uses a variety of cries for communicating with others.

data.name: Houndour

attacks.name: Coordinated Pack
attacks.text: For each of your Benched Houndour, search your deck for a Basic Darkness Energy card and attach it to that Houndour. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Focus Fangs
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: It is smart enough to hunt in packs. It uses a variety of cries for communicating with others.

data.name: Houndoom

attacks.name: Daring Strike
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is an Evolution Pokémon, this attack does 70 more damage.

attacks.name: Shadow Slash
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: If you are burned by the flames it shoots from its mouth, the pain will never go away.

data.name: Scizor

attacks.name: Punishing Scissors
attacks.text: This attack does 50 more damage for each of your opponent's Pokémon in play that has an Ability.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon's pincers, which contain steel, can crush any hard object they get ahold of into bits.

data.name: Darkrai

attacks.name: Dark Slumber
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Night Cyclone
attacks.text: Move all Energy from this Pokémon to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like.

data.flavorText: It can lull people to sleep and make them dream. It is active during nights of the new moon.

data.name: Skarmory

attacks.name: Slashing Steel
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Slashing Steel.

data.flavorText: People fashion swords from Skarmory's shed feathers, so this Pokémon is a popular element in heraldic designs.

data.name: Salandit
data.flavorText: It taunts its prey and lures them into narrow, rocky areas where it then sprays them with toxic gas to make them dizzy and take them down.

data.name: Togedemaru

attacks.name: Defense Curl
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks.

data.flavorText: When it's in trouble, it curls up into a ball, makes its fur spikes stand on end, and then discharges electricity indiscriminately.

data.name: Bronzor

attacks.name: Mirror Draw
attacks.text: Draw cards until you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent.

data.flavorText: Ancient people believed that the pattern on Bronzor's back contained a mysterious power.

data.name: Meltan
data.flavorText: They live as a group, but when the time comes, one strong Meltan will absorb all the others and evolve.

data.name: Bronzong

attacks.name: Oracle Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks used by your opponent's Pokémon done to this Pokémon. (Damage is not an effect.)

attacks.name: Extrasensory
attacks.text: If you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.flavorText: In ages past, this Pokémon was revered as a bringer of rain. It was found buried in the ground.

data.name: Melmetal ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Metal-bolize
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Metal Energy cards and attach them to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Full Metal Knuckle
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Metal Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Bisharp

attacks.name: Fury Cutter
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. If 1 of them is heads, this attack does 20 more damage. If 2 of them are heads, this attack does 60 more damage. If all of them are heads, this attack does 120 more damage.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon commands a group of several Pawniard. Groups that are defeated in territorial disputes are absorbed by the winning side.

data.name: Dragonair

attacks.name: Dragon Tail
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 70 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: They say that if it emits an aura from its whole body, the weather will begin to change instantly.

data.name: Kingambit

attacks.name: Strike Down
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has 4 or more damage counters on it, that Pokémon is Knocked Out.

data.flavorText: Only a Bisharp that stands above all others in its vast army can evolve into Kingambit.

data.name: Pidgey
data.flavorText: It is docile and prefers to avoid conflict. If disturbed, however, it can ferociously strike back.

data.name: Inkay

attacks.name: Hug
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

data.flavorText: By exposing foes to the blinking of its luminescent spots, Inkay demoralizes them, and then it seizes the chance to flee.

data.name: Umbreon

attacks.name: Feint Attack
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance, or by any effects on that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Pitch-Black Blade
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

data.flavorText: When exposed to the moon's aura, the rings on its body glow faintly and it gains a mysterious power.

data.name: Malamar

abilities.name: Psychic Insight
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may look at the top card of your opponent's deck. If you do, look at the top card of your deck.

attacks.name: Hypnotic Ray
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: It's said that Malamar's hypnotic powers played a role in certain history-changing events.

data.name: Salazzle
data.flavorText: Salazzle makes its opponents light-headed with poisonous gas, then captivates them with alluring movements to turn them into loyal servants.

data.name: Mawile

abilities.name: Special Eater
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may discard a Special Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It chomps with its gaping mouth. Its huge jaws are actually steel horns that have been transformed.

data.name: Excadrill
data.flavorText: Known as the Drill King, this Pokémon can tunnel through the terrain at speeds of over 90 mph.

data.name: Dratini
data.flavorText: It sheds many layers of skin as it grows larger. During this process, it is protected by a rapid waterfall.

data.name: Dragonite ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.
Tera: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).

attacks.name: Mighty Meteor
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 140 more damage. If tails, during your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

data.name: Drampa

attacks.name: Outrage
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Drampa is a kind and friendly Pokémon—up until it's angered. When that happens, it stirs up a gale and flattens everything around.

data.name: Houndoom ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Evil Claw
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Basic Pokémon, it can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Hound's Fang
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Absol ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Future Sight
attacks.text: Look at the top 3 cards of either player's deck and put them back in any order.

attacks.name: Cursed Slug
attacks.text: If your opponent has 3 or fewer cards in their hand, this attack does 120 more damage.

data.name: Probopass

attacks.name: Triple Nose
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 40 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Iron Buster
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

data.name: Lillipup
data.flavorText: This Pokémon is far brighter than the average child, and Lillipup won't forget the love it receives or any abuse it suffers.

attacks.name: Charge
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Lightning Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: When it is angered, it immediately discharges the energy stored in the pouches in its cheeks.

data.name: Pidgey

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: It is docile and prefers to avoid conflict. If disturbed, however, it can ferociously strike back.

data.name: Nidoran ♀

attacks.name: Poison Horn
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: It uses its hard incisor teeth to crush and eat berries. The tip of a female Nidoran's horn is a bit more rounded than the tip of a male's horn.

data.name: Spearow

abilities.name: Evolutionary Advantage
abilities.text: If you go second, this Pokémon can evolve during your first turn.

data.flavorText: Due to its short wings, it can't fly long distances. It wanders about restlessly and pecks at bug Pokémon.

data.name: Nidorino
data.flavorText: It's nervous and quick to act aggressively. The potency of its poison increases along with the level of adrenaline present in its body.

data.name: Nidorina

attacks.name: Fetch Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: If the group is threatened, these Pokémon will band together to assault enemies with a chorus of ultrasonic waves.

data.name: Nidoking

abilities.name: Enthusiastic King
abilities.text: If you have Nidoqueen in play, ignore all Energy in the costs of attacks used by this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Venomous Impact
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: Nidoking prides itself on its strength. It's forceful and spirited in battle, making use of its thick tail and diamond-crushing horn.

data.name: Nidoran ♂
data.flavorText: Small but brave, this Pokémon will hold its ground and even risk its life in battle to protect the female it's friendly with.

data.name: Clefairy

attacks.name: Moon-Viewing Invitation
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Clefairy and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: Its adorable behavior and cry make it highly popular. However, this cute Pokémon is rarely found.

data.name: Clefable

attacks.name: Follow Me
attacks.text: Switch in 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon to the Active Spot.

attacks.name: More Moon
attacks.text: If your opponent's Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from this attack, take 1 more Prize card.

data.flavorText: Their ears are sensitive enough to hear a pin drop from over a mile away, so they're usually found in quiet places.

data.name: Gloom

abilities.name: Semi-Blooming Energy
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may look at the top 3 cards of your deck and attach any number of Basic Energy cards you find there to your Pokémon in any way you like. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

data.flavorText: What appears to be drool is actually sweet honey. It is very sticky and clings stubbornly if touched.

data.name: Vileplume

abilities.name: Fully Blooming Energy
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may look at the top 8 cards of your deck and attach any number of Basic Energy cards you find there to your Pokémon in any way you like. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

data.flavorText: The larger its petals, the more toxic pollen it contains. Its big head is heavy and hard to hold up.

data.name: Paras

attacks.name: Spore Ball
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: The mushrooms, known as tochukaso, are controlling the bug. Even if the bug bugs the mushrooms, they tell it to bug off.

data.name: Dugtrio
data.flavorText: Its three heads bob separately up and down to loosen the soil nearby, making it easier for it to burrow.

data.name: Parasect

attacks.name: Spread Filaments
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. Search your deck for a number of Grass Pokémon up to the number of heads and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: The bug is mostly dead, with the mushroom on its back having become the main body. If the mushroom comes off, the bug stops moving.

data.name: Diglett
data.flavorText: It lives about one yard underground, where it feeds on plant roots. It sometimes appears aboveground.

data.name: Charmander

attacks.name: Blazing Destruction
attacks.text: Discard a Stadium in play.

data.flavorText: From the time it is born, a flame burns at the tip of its tail. Its life would end if the flame were to go out.

data.name: Kakuna

abilities.name: Cocoon Cover
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks used by your opponent's Pokémon done to this Pokémon. (Damage is not an effect.)

data.flavorText: While awaiting evolution, it hides from predators under leaves and in nooks of branches.

data.name: Charmeleon

attacks.name: Fire Blast
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: If it becomes agitated during battle, it spouts intense flames, incinerating its surroundings.

data.name: Charizard ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Brave Wing
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any damage counters on it, this attack does 100 more damage.

attacks.name: Explosive Vortex
attacks.text: Discard 3 Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Caterpie

attacks.name: Leaf Munch
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Grass Pokémon, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: Its short feet are tipped with suction pads that enable it to tirelessly climb slopes and walls.

data.name: Metapod

attacks.name: Defensive Posture
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks.

data.flavorText: Even though it is encased in a sturdy shell, the body inside is tender. It can't withstand a harsh attack.

data.name: Weedle
data.flavorText: Its poison stinger is very powerful. Its bright-colored body is intended to warn off its enemies.

data.name: Pidgeotto
data.flavorText: Very protective of its sprawling territorial area, this Pokémon will fiercely peck at any intruder.

data.name: Pidgeot

attacks.name: Fly
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from and effects of attacks done to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It spreads its gorgeous wings widely to intimidate enemies. It races through the skies at Mach-2 speed.

data.name: Raichu

abilities.name: Electrical Grounding
abilities.text: When 1 of your Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from an attack from your opponent's Pokémon, you may move a Lightning Energy from that Pokémon to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Thunder
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 50 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: Its tail discharges electricity into the ground, protecting it from getting shocked.

data.name: Sandshrew

abilities.name: Sand Screen
abilities.text: Trainer cards in your opponent's discard pile can't be put into their deck by an effect of your opponent's Item or Supporter cards.

data.flavorText: It burrows into the ground to create its nest. If hard stones impede its tunneling, it uses its sharp claws to shatter them and then carries on digging.

data.name: Sandslash

attacks.name: Rumble
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

attacks.name: Spike Rend
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 100 more damage.

data.flavorText: It climbs trees by hooking on with its sharp claws. Sandslash shares the berries it gathers, dropping them down to Sandshrew waiting below the tree.

data.name: Nidoqueen

attacks.name: Queen Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from Basic Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It pacifies offspring by placing them in the gaps between the spines on its back. The spines will never secrete poison while young are present.

data.name: Jigglypuff

attacks.name: Lead
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Supporter card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Stompy Stomp
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: When its huge eyes waver, it sings a mysteriously soothing melody that lulls its enemies to sleep.

data.name: Wigglytuff ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Expanding Body
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has any Special Energy attached, it gets +100 HP.

attacks.name: Friend Tackle
attacks.text: If you played a Supporter card from your hand during this turn, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.name: Zubat

abilities.name: Revealing Echo
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, you may have your opponent reveal their hand.

data.flavorText: Zubat live in caves, down where the sun's light won't reach. In the morning, they gather together to keep each other warm as they sleep.

data.name: Oddish
data.flavorText: During the day, it stays in the cold underground to avoid the sun. It grows by bathing in moonlight.

data.name: Venomoth

attacks.name: Perplexing Powder
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused. During your opponent's next turn, they can't play any Item cards from their hand.

data.flavorText: The wings are covered with dustlike scales. Every time it flaps its wings, it looses highly toxic dust.

data.name: Beedrill

attacks.name: Nadir Needle
attacks.text: If you have no cards in your hand, this attack does 120 more damage, and your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned.

data.flavorText: May appear in a swarm. Flies at violent speeds, all the while stabbing with the toxic stinger on its rear.

data.name: Raticate

attacks.name: Second Bite
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Its whiskers are essential for maintaining its balance. No matter how friendly you are, it will get angry and bite you if you touch its whiskers.

data.name: Fearow

attacks.name: Beak Catch
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: Carrying food through Fearow's territory is dangerous. It will snatch the food away from you in a flash!

data.name: Vulpix

attacks.name: Super Singe
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

data.flavorText: As each tail grows, its fur becomes more lustrous. When held, it feels slightly warm.

data.name: Ninetales ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Heat Wave
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Mirrored Flames
attacks.text: If you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent, this attack does 140 more damage.

data.name: Golbat

attacks.name: Skill Dive
attacks.text: This attack does 40 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Its feet are tiny, but this Pokémon walks skillfully. It sneaks up on sleeping prey before sinking in its fangs and slurping up blood.

data.name: Venonat
data.flavorText: Poison oozes from all over its body. It catches small bug Pokémon at night that are attracted by light.

data.name: Meowth

attacks.name: Come Here Right Meow
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, switch in 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon to the Active Spot.

data.flavorText: All it does is sleep during the daytime. At night, it patrols its territory with its eyes aglow.

data.name: Persian

abilities.name: Rocket Call
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may search your deck for a Giovanni's Charisma card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: Although its fur has many admirers, it is tough to raise as a pet because of its fickle meanness.

data.name: Arcanine

attacks.name: Torrid Torrent
attacks.text: Attach up to 2 Basic Fire Energy cards from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dynamite Fang
attacks.text: Discard 2 Fire Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: An ancient picture scroll shows that people were captivated by its movement as it ran through prairies.

data.name: Psyduck

attacks.name: Overthink
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, whenever they flip a coin, treat it as tails.

data.flavorText: It is constantly wracked by a headache. When the headache turns intense, it begins using mysterious powers.

data.name: Poliwag

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: In rivers with fast-flowing water, this Pokémon will cling to a rock by using its thick lips, which act like a suction cup.

data.name: Poliwhirl

attacks.name: Frog Hop
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon's sweat is a slimy mucus. When captured, Poliwhirl can slither from its enemies' grasp and escape.

data.name: Victreebel

attacks.name: Slow-Acting Acid
attacks.text: At the end of your opponent's next turn, put 12 damage counters on the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Once ingested into this Pokémon's body, even the hardest object will melt into nothing.

data.name: Rapidash

attacks.name: Singe
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Mach Turn
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The fastest runner becomes the leader, and it decides the herd's pace and direction of travel.

data.name: Magneton

attacks.name: Junk Magnet
attacks.text: Put up to 2 Item cards from your discard pile into your hand.

data.flavorText: Three Magnemite are linked by a strong magnetic force. Earaches will occur if you get too close.

data.name: Dodrio

abilities.name: Zooming Draw
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may put 1 damage counter on this Pokémon. If you do, draw a card.

attacks.name: Ballistic Beak
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: An odd species that is rarely found. The three heads respectively represent joy, sadness, and anger.

data.name: Gastly
data.flavorText: It wraps its opponent in its gas-like body, slowly weakening its prey by poisoning it through the skin.

data.name: Gengar

attacks.name: Poltergeist
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand. This attack does 50 damage for each Trainer card you find there.

attacks.name: Hollow Dive
attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on your opponent's Benched Pokémon in any way you like.

data.flavorText: To steal the life of its target, it slips into the prey's shadow and silently waits for an opportunity.
